post.description:
Imports a CSV file into a product to propagate arbitrary meta and tags on endpoints.

By Names:
- Provide `product_name` of existing product

By ID:
- Provide the id of the product in the `product` parameter

In this scenario Defect Dojo will look up the product by the provided details.

parameters.name: epss_percentile_max
parameters.description: The range of EPSS percentiles to filter on; the min input is a lower bound, the max is an upper bound. Leaving one empty will skip that bound (e.g., leaving the min bound input empty will filter only on the max bound -- filtering on "less than or equal"). Leading 0 required.

parameters.name: epss_percentile_min
parameters.description: The range of EPSS percentiles to filter on; the min input is a lower bound, the max is an upper bound. Leaving one empty will skip that bound (e.g., leaving the min bound input empty will filter only on the max bound -- filtering on "less than or equal"). Leading 0 required.

parameters.name: epss_score_max
parameters.description: The range of EPSS score percentages to filter on; the min input is a lower bound, the max is an upper bound. Leaving one empty will skip that bound (e.g., leaving the min bound input empty will filter only on the max bound -- filtering on "less than or equal"). Leading 0 required.

parameters.name: epss_score_min
parameters.description: The range of EPSS score percentages to filter on; the min input is a lower bound, the max is an upper bound. Leaving one empty will skip that bound (e.g., leaving the min bound input empty will filter only on the max bound -- filtering on "less than or equal"). Leading 0 required.

post.description:
Imports a scan report into an engagement or product.

By ID:
- Create a Product (or use an existing product)
- Create an Engagement inside the product
- Provide the id of the engagement in the `engagement` parameter

In this scenario a new Test will be created inside the engagement.

By Names:
- Create a Product (or use an existing product)
- Create an Engagement inside the product
- Provide `product_name`
- Provide `engagement_name`
- Optionally provide `product_type_name`

In this scenario Defect Dojo will look up the Engagement by the provided details.

When using names you can let the importer automatically create Engagements, Products and Product_Types
by using `auto_create_context=True`.

When `auto_create_context` is set to `True` you can use `deduplication_on_engagement` to restrict deduplication for
imported Findings to the newly created Engagement.

post.description:
Reimports a scan report into an existing test.

By ID:
- Create a Product (or use an existing product)
- Create an Engagement inside the product
- Import a scan report and find the id of the Test
- Provide this in the `test` parameter

By Names:
- Create a Product (or use an existing product)
- Create an Engagement inside the product
- Import a report which will create a Test
- Provide `product_name`
- Provide `engagement_name`
- Optional: Provide `test_title`

In this scenario Defect Dojo will look up the Test by the provided details.
If no `test_title` is provided, the latest test inside the engagement will be chosen based on scan_type.

When using names you can let the importer automatically create Engagements, Products and Product_Types
by using `auto_create_context=True`.

When `auto_create_context` is set to `True` you can use `deduplication_on_engagement` to restrict deduplication for
imported Findings to the newly created Engagement.

parameters.name: decision
parameters.description:
Risk treatment decision by risk owner

* `A` - Accept (The risk is acknowledged, yet remains)
* `V` - Avoid (Do not engage with whatever creates the risk)
* `M` - Mitigate (The risk still exists, yet compensating controls make it less of a threat)
* `F` - Fix (The risk is eradicated)
* `T` - Transfer (The risk is transferred to a 3rd party)

title.description: A short description of the flaw.

date.description: The date the flaw was discovered.

sla_start_date.description: (readonly)The date used as start date for SLA calculation. Set by expiring risk acceptances. Empty by default, causing a fallback to 'date'.

sla_expiration_date.description: (readonly)The date SLA expires for this finding. Empty by default, causing a fallback to 'date'.

cwe.description: The CWE number associated with this flaw.

epss_score.description: EPSS score for the CVE. Describes how likely it is the vulnerability will be exploited in the next 30 days.

epss_percentile.description: EPSS percentile for the CVE. Describes how many CVEs are scored at or below this one.

known_exploited.description: Whether this vulnerability is known to have been exploited in the wild.

ransomware_used.title: Used in Ransomware
ransomware_used.description: Whether this vulnerability is known to have been leveraged as part of a ransomware campaign.

kev_date.title: KEV Date Added
kev_date.description: The date the vulnerability was added to the KEV catalog.

cvssv3.title: CVSS3 Vector
cvssv3.description: Common Vulnerability Scoring System version 3 (CVSS3) score associated with this finding.

cvssv3_score.title: CVSS3 Score
cvssv3_score.description: Numerical CVSSv3 score for the vulnerability. If the vector is given, the score is updated while saving the finding. The value must be between 0-10.

cvssv4.title: CVSS4 vector
cvssv4.description: Common Vulnerability Scoring System version 4 (CVSS4) score associated with this finding.

cvssv4_score.description: Numerical CVSSv4 score for the vulnerability. If the vector is given, the score is updated while saving the finding. The value must be between 0-10.

url.description: External reference that provides more information about this flaw.

severity.description: The severity level of this flaw (Critical, High, Medium, Low, Info).

description.description: Longer more descriptive information about the flaw.

mitigation.description: Text describing how to best fix the flaw.

fix_available.description: Denotes if there is a fix available for this flaw.

fix_version.description: Version of the affected component in which the flaw is fixed.

impact.description: Text describing the impact this flaw has on systems, products, enterprise, etc.

steps_to_reproduce.description: Text describing the steps that must be followed in order to reproduce the flaw / bug.

severity_justification.description: Text describing why a certain severity was associated with this flaw.

references.description: The external documentation available for this flaw.

active.description: Denotes if this flaw is active or not.

verified.description: Denotes if this flaw has been manually verified by the tester.

false_p.title: False Positive
false_p.description: Denotes if this flaw has been deemed a false positive by the tester.

duplicate.description: Denotes if this flaw is a duplicate of other flaws reported.

out_of_scope.description: Denotes if this flaw falls outside the scope of the test and/or engagement.

risk_accepted.description: Denotes if this finding has been marked as an accepted risk.

under_review.description: Denotes is this flaw is currently being reviewed.

last_status_update.description: Timestamp of latest status update (change in status related fields).

under_defect_review.description: Denotes if this finding is under defect review.

is_mitigated.description: Denotes if this flaw has been fixed.

numerical_severity.description: The numerical representation of the severity (S0, S1, S2, S3, S4).

last_reviewed.description: Provides the date the flaw was last 'touched' by a tester.

cvssv4_score.description: Numerical CVSSv4 score for the vulnerability. If the vector is given, the score is updated while saving the finding. The value must be between 0-10.

severity.description: The severity level of this flaw (Critical, High, Medium, Low, Info).

description.description: Longer more descriptive information about the flaw.

mitigation.description: Text describing how to best fix the flaw.

fix_available.description: Denotes if there is a fix available for this flaw.

fix_version.description: Version of the affected component in which the flaw is fixed.

impact.description: Text describing the impact this flaw has on systems, products, enterprise, etc.

steps_to_reproduce.description: Text describing the steps that must be followed in order to reproduce the flaw / bug.

severity_justification.description: Text describing why a certain severity was associated with this flaw.

references.description: The external documentation available for this flaw.

active.description: Denotes if this flaw is active or not.

verified.description: Denotes if this flaw has been manually verified by the tester.

false_p.title: False Positive
false_p.description: Denotes if this flaw has been deemed a false positive by the tester.

duplicate.description: Denotes if this flaw is a duplicate of other flaws reported.

out_of_scope.description: Denotes if this flaw falls outside the scope of the test and/or engagement.

risk_accepted.description: Denotes if this finding has been marked as an accepted risk.

under_review.description: Denotes is this flaw is currently being reviewed.

under_defect_review.description: Denotes if this finding is under defect review.

is_mitigated.description: Denotes if this flaw has been fixed.

numerical_severity.description: The numerical representation of the severity (S0, S1, S2, S3, S4).

line.title: Line number
line.description: Source line number of the attack vector.

component_name.description: Name of the affected component (library name, part of a system, ...).

static_finding.title: Static finding (SAST)
static_finding.description: Flaw has been detected from a Static Application Security Testing tool (SAST).

dynamic_finding.title: Dynamic finding (DAST)
dynamic_finding.description: Flaw has been detected from a Dynamic Application Security Testing tool (DAST).

unique_id_from_tool.description: Vulnerability technical id from the source tool. Allows to track unique vulnerabilities over time across subsequent scans.

vuln_id_from_tool.title: Vulnerability ID from tool
vuln_id_from_tool.description: Non-unique technical id from the source tool associated with the vulnerability type.

sast_source_object.description: Source object (variable, function...) of the attack vector.

sast_sink_object.description: Sink object (variable, function...) of the attack vector.

sast_source_line.title: SAST Source Line number
sast_source_line.description: Source line number of the attack vector.

sast_source_file_path.description: Source file path of the attack vector.

nb_occurences.title: Number of occurences
nb_occurences.description: Number of occurences in the source tool when several vulnerabilites were found and aggregated by the scanner.

publish_date.description: Date when this vulnerability was made publicly available.

service.description: A service is a self-contained piece of functionality within a Product. This is an optional field which is used in deduplication of findings when set.

planned_remediation_date.description: The date the flaw is expected to be remediated.

planned_remediation_version.description: The target version when the vulnerability should be fixed / remediated

effort_for_fixing.description: Effort for fixing / remediating the vulnerability (Low, Medium, High)

review_requested_by.description: Documents who requested a review for this finding.

defect_review_requested_by.description: Documents who requested a defect review for this flaw.

sonarqube_issue.description: The SonarQube issue associated with this finding.

version.description: Version of the product the engagement tested.

title.description: A short description of the flaw.

date.description: The date the flaw was discovered.

sla_start_date.description: (readonly)The date used as start date for SLA calculation. Set by expiring risk acceptances. Empty by default, causing a fallback to 'date'.

sla_expiration_date.description: (readonly)The date SLA expires for this finding. Empty by default, causing a fallback to 'date'.

cwe.description: The CWE number associated with this flaw.

epss_score.description: EPSS score for the CVE. Describes how likely it is the vulnerability will be exploited in the next 30 days.

epss_percentile.description: EPSS percentile for the CVE. Describes how many CVEs are scored at or below this one.

known_exploited.description: Whether this vulnerability is known to have been exploited in the wild.

ransomware_used.title: Used in Ransomware
ransomware_used.description: Whether this vulnerability is known to have been leveraged as part of a ransomware campaign.

tags.description: Add tags that help describe this scan.

close_old_findings.description: Old findings no longer present in the new report get closed as mitigated when importing. If service has been set, only the findings for this service will be closed; if no service is set, only findings without a service will be closed. This only affects findings within the same engagement.

close_old_findings_product_scope.description: Old findings no longer present in the new report get closed as mitigated when importing. If service has been set, only the findings for this service will be closed; if no service is set, only findings without a service will be closed. This only affects findings within the same product.By default, it is false meaning that only old findings of the same type in the engagement are in scope.

tags.description: Add tags that help describe this scan.

close_old_findings.description: Old findings no longer present in the new report get closed as mitigated when importing. If service has been set, only the findings for this service will be closed; if no service is set, only findings without a service will be closed. This only affects findings within the same engagement.

close_old_findings_product_scope.description: Old findings no longer present in the new report get closed as mitigated when importing. If service has been set, only the findings for this service will be closed; if no service is set, only findings without a service will be closed. This only affects findings within the same product.By default, it is false meaning that only old findings of the same type in the engagement are in scope.

delta.description: Finding statistics of modifications made by the reimport. Only available when TRACK_IMPORT_HISTORY has not been disabled.

after.description: Finding statistics as stored in Defect Dojo after the import

close_status_key.title: Close Transition ID

info_mapping_severity.description: Maps to the 'Priority' field in Jira. For example: Info

low_mapping_severity.description: Maps to the 'Priority' field in Jira. For example: Low

medium_mapping_severity.description: Maps to the 'Priority' field in Jira. For example: Medium

high_mapping_severity.description: Maps to the 'Priority' field in Jira. For example: High

critical_mapping_severity.description: Maps to the 'Priority' field in Jira. For example: Critical

finding_text.description: Additional text that will be added to the finding in Jira. For example including how the finding was created or who to contact for more information.

accepted_mapping_resolution.title: Risk Accepted resolution mapping
accepted_mapping_resolution.description: JIRA issues that are closed in JIRA with one of these resolutions will result in the Finding becoming Risk Accepted in Defect Dojo. JIRA issues that are closed in JIRA with one of these resolutions will result in the Finding becoming Risk Accepted in Defect Dojo. The expiration time for this Risk Acceptance will be determined by the "Risk acceptance form default days" in "System Settings". This mapping is not used when Findings are pushed to JIRA. In that case the Risk Accepted Findings are closed in JIRA and JIRA sets the default resolution.

false_positive_mapping_resolution.title: False Positive resolution mapping
false_positive_mapping_resolution.description: JIRA issues that are closed in JIRA with one of these resolutions will result in the Finding being marked as False Positive Defect Dojo. This mapping is not used when Findings are pushed to JIRA. In that case the Finding is closed in JIRA and JIRA sets the default resolution.

user_records.description: Estimate the number of user records within the application.

internet_accessible.description: Specify if the application is accessible from the public internet.

Group imported from a social provider.

* `AzureAD` - AzureAD
* `Remote` - Remote

protocol.description: The communication protocol/scheme such as 'http', 'ftp', 'dns', etc.

host.description: The host name or IP address. It must not include the port number. For example '127.0.0.1', 'localhost', 'yourdomain.com'.

port.description: The network port associated with the endpoint.

path.description: The location of the resource, it must not start with a '/'. For example endpoint/420/edit

query.description: The query string, the question mark should be omitted.For example 'group=4&team=8'

fragment.description: The fragment identifier which follows the hash mark. The hash mark should be omitted. For example 'section-13', 'paragraph-2'.

notes.description: Description of what needs to be tested or setting up environment for testing

version.description: Version of the product the engagement tested.

tracker.description: Link to epic or ticket system with changes to version.

status.description:
* `Not Started` - Not Started
* `Blocked` - Blocked
* `Cancelled` - Cancelled
* `Completed` - Completed
* `In Progress` - In Progress
* `On Hold` - On Hold
* `Waiting for Resource` - Waiting for Resource

build_id.description: Build ID of the product the engagement tested.

branch_tag.title: Branch/Tag
branch_tag.description: Tag or branch of the product the engagement tested.

deduplication_on_engagement.title: Deduplication within this engagement only
deduplication_on_engagement.description: If enabled deduplication will only mark a finding in this engagement as duplicate of another finding if both findings are in this engagement. If disabled, deduplication is on the product level.

preset.description: Settings and notes for performing this engagement.

build_server.description: Build server responsible for CI/CD test

source_code_management_server.title: SCM Server
source_code_management_server.description: Source code server for CI/CD test

orchestration_engine.description: Orchestration service responsible for CI/CD test

title.description: A short description of the flaw.

date.description: The date the flaw was discovered.

sla_start_date.description: (readonly)The date used as start date for SLA calculation. Set by expiring risk acceptances. Empty by default, causing a fallback to 'date'.

sla_expiration_date.description: (readonly)The date SLA expires for this finding. Empty by default, causing a fallback to 'date'.

cwe.description: The CWE number associated with this flaw.

epss_score.description: EPSS score for the CVE. Describes how likely it is the vulnerability will be exploited in the next 30 days.

epss_percentile.description: EPSS percentile for the CVE. Describes how many CVEs are scored at or below this one.

known_exploited.description: Whether this vulnerability is known to have been exploited in the wild.

ransomware_used.title: Used in Ransomware
ransomware_used.description: Whether this vulnerability is known to have been leveraged as part of a ransomware campaign.

kev_date.title: KEV Date Added
kev_date.description: The date the vulnerability was added to the KEV catalog.

cvssv3.title: CVSS3 Vector
cvssv3.description: Common Vulnerability Scoring System version 3 (CVSS3) score associated with this finding.

cvssv3_score.title: CVSS3 Score
cvssv3_score.description: Numerical CVSSv3 score for the vulnerability. If the vector is given, the score is updated while saving the finding. The value must be between 0-10.

cvssv4.title: CVSS4 vector
cvssv4.description: Common Vulnerability Scoring System version 4 (CVSS4) score associated with this finding.

cvssv4_score.description: Numerical CVSSv4 score for the vulnerability. If the vector is given, the score is updated while saving the finding. The value must be between 0-10.

severity.description: The severity level of this flaw (Critical, High, Medium, Low, Info).

description.description: Longer more descriptive information about the flaw.

mitigation.description: Text describing how to best fix the flaw.

fix_available.description: Denotes if there is a fix available for this flaw.

fix_version.description: Version of the affected component in which the flaw is fixed.

impact.description: Text describing the impact this flaw has on systems, products, enterprise, etc.

steps_to_reproduce.description: Text describing the steps that must be followed in order to reproduce the flaw / bug.

severity_justification.description: Text describing why a certain severity was associated with this flaw.

references.description: The external documentation available for this flaw.

active.description: Denotes if this flaw is active or not.

verified.description: Denotes if this flaw has been manually verified by the tester.

false_p.title: False Positive
false_p.description: Denotes if this flaw has been deemed a false positive by the tester.

duplicate.description: Denotes if this flaw is a duplicate of other flaws reported.

out_of_scope.description: Denotes if this flaw falls outside the scope of the test and/or engagement.

risk_accepted.description: Denotes if this finding has been marked as an accepted risk.

under_review.description: Denotes is this flaw is currently being reviewed.

under_defect_review.description: Denotes if this finding is under defect review.

is_mitigated.description: Denotes if this flaw has been fixed.

numerical_severity.description: The numerical representation of the severity (S0, S1, S2, S3, S4).

line.title: Line number
line.description: Source line number of the attack vector.

component_name.description: Name of the affected component (library name, part of a system, ...).

static_finding.title: Static finding (SAST)
static_finding.description: Flaw has been detected from a Static Application Security Testing tool (SAST).

dynamic_finding.title: Dynamic finding (DAST)
dynamic_finding.description: Flaw has been detected from a Dynamic Application Security Testing tool (DAST).

unique_id_from_tool.description: Vulnerability technical id from the source tool. Allows to track unique vulnerabilities over time across subsequent scans.

vuln_id_from_tool.title: Vulnerability ID from tool
vuln_id_from_tool.description: Non-unique technical id from the source tool associated with the vulnerability type.

sast_source_object.description: Source object (variable, function...) of the attack vector.

sast_sink_object.description: Sink object (variable, function...) of the attack vector.

sast_source_line.title: SAST Source Line number
sast_source_line.description: Source line number of the attack vector.

sast_source_file_path.description: Source file path of the attack vector.

nb_occurences.title: Number of occurences
nb_occurences.description: Number of occurences in the source tool when several vulnerabilites were found and aggregated by the scanner.

publish_date.description: Date when this vulnerability was made publicly available.

service.description: A service is a self-contained piece of functionality within a Product. This is an optional field which is used in deduplication of findings when set.

planned_remediation_date.description: The date the flaw is expected to be remediated.

planned_remediation_version.description: The target version when the vulnerability should be fixed / remediated

effort_for_fixing.description: Effort for fixing / remediating the vulnerability (Low, Medium, High)

review_requested_by.description: Documents who requested a review for this finding.

defect_review_requested_by.description: Documents who requested a defect review for this flaw.

sonarqube_issue.description: The SonarQube issue associated with this finding.

cvssv3.title: CVSS v3 vector
cvssv3.description: Common Vulnerability Scoring System version 3 (CVSSv3) score associated with this finding.

cvssv4.title: CVSS4 vector
cvssv4.description: Common Vulnerability Scoring System version 4 (CVSS4) score associated with this finding.

fix_available.description: Indicates if a fix is available for this vulnerability type

steps_to_reproduce.description: Standard reproduction steps for this vulnerability type

severity_justification.description: Explanation of why this severity level is appropriate

notes.description: Note content to add when applying this template

role.title: Global role
role.description: The global role will be applied to all product types and products.

configuration_name.description: Enter a name to give to this configuration

url.title: JIRA URL
url.description: For more information how to configure Jira, read the DefectDojo documentation.

username.title: Username/Email
username.description: Username or Email Address, see DefectDojo documentation for more information.

password.title: Password/Token
password.description: Password or API Token, see DefectDojo documentation for more information.

default_issue_type.description:
You can define extra issue types in settings.py

* `Task` - Task
* `Story` - Story
* `Epic` - Epic
* `Spike` - Spike
* `Bug` - Bug
* `Security` - Security

issue_template_dir.description: Choose the folder containing the Django templates used to render the JIRA issue description. These are stored in dojo/templates/issue-trackers. Leave empty to use the default jira_full templates.

epic_name_id.description: To obtain the 'Epic name id' visit https://<YOUR JIRA URL>/rest/api/2/field and search for Epic Name. Copy the number out of cf[number] and paste it here.

open_status_key.title: Reopen Transition ID
open_status_key.description: Transition ID to Re-Open JIRA issues, visit https://<YOUR JIRA URL>/rest/api/latest/issue/<ANY VALID ISSUE KEY>/transitions?expand=transitions.fields to find the ID for your JIRA instance

close_status_key.title: Close Transition ID
close_status_key.description: Transition ID to Close JIRA issues, visit https://<YOUR JIRA URL>/rest/api/latest/issue/<ANY VALID ISSUE KEY>/transitions?expand=transitions.fields to find the ID for your JIRA instance

info_mapping_severity.description: Maps to the 'Priority' field in Jira. For example: Info

low_mapping_severity.description: Maps to the 'Priority' field in Jira. For example: Low

medium_mapping_severity.description: Maps to the 'Priority' field in Jira. For example: Medium

high_mapping_severity.description: Maps to the 'Priority' field in Jira. For example: High

critical_mapping_severity.description: Maps to the 'Priority' field in Jira. For example: Critical

finding_text.description: Additional text that will be added to the finding in Jira. For example including how the finding was created or who to contact for more information.

accepted_mapping_resolution.title: Risk Accepted resolution mapping
accepted_mapping_resolution.description: JIRA issues that are closed in JIRA with one of these resolutions will result in the Finding becoming Risk Accepted in Defect Dojo. JIRA issues that are closed in JIRA with one of these resolutions will result in the Finding becoming Risk Accepted in Defect Dojo. The expiration time for this Risk Acceptance will be determined by the "Risk acceptance form default days" in "System Settings". This mapping is not used when Findings are pushed to JIRA. In that case the Risk Accepted Findings are closed in JIRA and JIRA sets the default resolution.

false_positive_mapping_resolution.title: False Positive resolution mapping
false_positive_mapping_resolution.description: JIRA issues that are closed in JIRA with one of these resolutions will result in the Finding being marked as False Positive Defect Dojo. This mapping is not used when Findings are pushed to JIRA. In that case the Finding is closed in JIRA and JIRA sets the default resolution.

global_jira_sla_notification.title: Globally send SLA notifications as comment?
global_jira_sla_notification.description: This setting can be overidden at the Product level

finding_jira_sync.title: Automatically sync Findings with JIRA?
finding_jira_sync.description: If enabled, this will sync changes to a Finding automatically to JIRA

jira_creation.description: The date a Jira issue was created from this finding.

jira_change.title: Jira last update
jira_change.description: The date the linked Jira issue was last modified.

issue_template_dir.description: Choose the folder containing the Django templates used to render the JIRA issue description. These are stored in dojo/templates/issue-trackers. Leave empty to use the default jira_full templates.

custom_fields.description: JIRA custom field JSON mapping of Id to value, e.g. {"customfield_10122": [{"name": "8.0.1"}]}

default_assignee.description: JIRA default assignee (name). If left blank then it defaults to whatever is configured in JIRA.

add_vulnerability_id_to_jira_label.title: Add vulnerability Id as a JIRA label

push_all_issues.description: Automatically create JIRA tickets for verified findings, assuming enforce_verified_status is True, or for all findings otherwise. Once linked, the JIRA ticket will continue to sync, regardless of status in DefectDojo.

epic_issue_type_name.description: The name of the of structure that represents an Epic

risk_acceptance_expiration_notification.title: Send Risk Acceptance expiration notifications as comment?

enabled.title: Enable Connection With Jira Project
enabled.description: When disabled, Findings will no longer be pushed to Jira, even if they have already been pushed previously.

location.description: Location of network testing: Examples: VPN, Internet or Internal.

url.description: The full URL of the incoming webhook

header_name.description: Name of the header required for interacting with Webhook endpoint

header_value.description: Content of the header required for interacting with Webhook endpoint

owner.description: Owner/receiver of notification, if empty processed as system notification

* `slack` - slack
* `msteams` - msteams
* `mail` - mail
* `webhooks` - webhooks
* `alert` - alert

user_records.description: Estimate the number of user records within the application.

external_audience.description: Specify if the application is used by people outside the organization.

internet_accessible.description: Specify if the application is accessible from the public internet.

enable_product_tag_inheritance.description: Enables product tag inheritance. Any tags added on a product will automatically be added to all Engagements, Tests, and Findings

enable_simple_risk_acceptance.description: Allows simple risk acceptance by checking/unchecking a checkbox.

enable_full_risk_acceptance.description: Allows full risk acceptance using a risk acceptance form, expiration date, uploaded proof, etc.

disable_sla_breach_notifications.description: Disable SLA breach notifications if configured in the global settings

acronym.description: A shortened representation of the name.

category.description:
The subject of the regulation.

* `privacy` - Privacy
* `finance` - Finance
* `education` - Education
* `medical` - Medical
* `corporate` - Corporate
* `security` - Security
* `government` - Government
* `other` - Other

jurisdiction.description: The territory over which the regulation applies.

reference.description: An external URL for more information.

name.description: Descriptive name which in the future may also be used to group risk acceptances together across engagements and products

recommendation.title: Security Recommendation
recommendation.description:
Recommendation from the security team.

* `A` - Accept (The risk is acknowledged, yet remains)
* `V` - Avoid (Do not engage with whatever creates the risk)
* `M` - Mitigate (The risk still exists, yet compensating controls make it less of a threat)
* `F` - Fix (The risk is eradicated)
* `T` - Transfer (The risk is transferred to a 3rd party)

decision.description:
Risk treatment decision by risk owner

* `A` - Accept (The risk is acknowledged, yet remains)
* `V` - Avoid (Do not engage with whatever creates the risk)
* `M` - Mitigate (The risk still exists, yet compensating controls make it less of a threat)
* `F` - Fix (The risk is eradicated)
* `T` - Transfer (The risk is transferred to a 3rd party)

decision_details.description: If a compensating control exists to mitigate the finding or reduce risk, then list the compensating control(s).

accepted_by.description: The person that accepts the risk, can be outside of DefectDojo.

expiration_date.description: When the risk acceptance expires, the findings will be reactivated (unless disabled below).

expiration_date_warned.description: (readonly) Date at which notice about the risk acceptance expiration was sent.

expiration_date_handled.description: (readonly) When the risk acceptance expiration was handled (manually or by the daily job).

reactivate_expired.title: Reactivate findings on expiration
reactivate_expired.description: Reactivate findings when risk acceptance expires?

restart_sla_expired.title: Restart SLA on expiration
restart_sla_expired.description: When enabled, the SLA for findings is restarted when the risk acceptance expires.

owner.description: User in DefectDojo owning this acceptance. Only the owner and staff users can edit the risk acceptance.

name.title: Custom SLA Name
name.description: A unique name for the set of SLAs.

critical.title: Critical Finding SLA Days
critical.description: The number of days to remediate a critical finding.

enforce_critical.title: Enforce Critical Finding SLA Days
enforce_critical.description: When enabled, critical findings will be assigned an SLA expiration date based on the critical finding SLA days within this SLA configuration.

high.title: High Finding SLA Days
high.description: The number of days to remediate a high finding.

enforce_high.title: Enforce High Finding SLA Days
enforce_high.description: When enabled, high findings will be assigned an SLA expiration date based on the high finding SLA days within this SLA configuration.

medium.title: Medium Finding SLA Days
medium.description: The number of days to remediate a medium finding.

enforce_medium.title: Enforce Medium Finding SLA Days
enforce_medium.description: When enabled, medium findings will be assigned an SLA expiration date based on the medium finding SLA days within this SLA configuration.

low.title: Low Finding SLA Days
low.description: The number of days to remediate a low finding.

enforce_low.title: Enforce Low Finding SLA Days
enforce_low.description: When enabled, low findings will be assigned an SLA expiration date based on the low finding SLA days within this SLA configuration.

restart_sla_on_reactivation.title: Restart SLA when findings are reactivated
restart_sla_on_reactivation.description: When enabled, findings that were previously mitigated but are reactivated durign reimport will have their SLA period restarted.

enable_deduplication.title: Deduplicate findings
enable_deduplication.description: With this setting turned on, DefectDojo deduplicates findings by comparing endpoints, cwe fields, and titles. If two findings share a URL and have the same CWE or title, DefectDojo marks the recent finding as a duplicate. When deduplication is enabled, a list of deduplicated findings is added to the engagement view.

delete_duplicates.description: Requires next setting: maximum number of duplicates to retain.

max_dupes.title: Max Duplicates
max_dupes.description: When enabled, if a single issue reaches the maximum number of duplicates, the oldest will be deleted. Duplicate will not be deleted when left empty. A value of 0 will remove all duplicates.

enable_jira_web_hook.description: Please note: It is strongly recommended to use a secret below and / or IP whitelist the JIRA server using a proxy such as Nginx.

disable_jira_webhook_secret.title: Disable web hook secret
disable_jira_webhook_secret.description: Allows incoming requests without a secret (discouraged legacy behaviour)

jira_webhook_secret.title: JIRA Webhook URL
jira_webhook_secret.description: Secret needed in URL for incoming JIRA Webhook

add_vulnerability_id_to_jira_label.title: Add vulnerability Id as a JIRA label

slack_channel.description: Optional. Needed if you want to send global notifications.

slack_token.description: Token required for interacting with Slack. Get one at https://api.slack.com/tokens

slack_username.description: Optional. Will take your bot name otherwise.

msteams_url.description: The full URL of the incoming webhook

webhooks_notifications_timeout.description: How many seconds will DefectDojo waits for response from webhook endpoint

enforce_verified_status.title: Enforce Verified Status - Globally
enforce_verified_status.description: When enabled, features such as product grading, jira integration, metrics, and reports will only interact with verified findings. This setting will override individually scoped verified toggles.

enforce_verified_status_jira.title: Enforce Verified Status - Jira
enforce_verified_status_jira.description: When enabled, findings must have a verified status to be pushed to jira.

enforce_verified_status_product_grading.title: Enforce Verified Status - Product Grading
enforce_verified_status_product_grading.description: When enabled, findings must have a verified status to be considered as part of a product's grading.

enforce_verified_status_metrics.title: Enforce Verified Status - Metrics
enforce_verified_status_metrics.description: When enabled, findings must have a verified status to be counted in metric calculations, be included in reports, and filters.

false_positive_history.description: (EXPERIMENTAL) DefectDojo will automatically mark the finding as a false positive if an equal finding (according to its dedupe algorithm) has been previously marked as a false positive on the same product. ATTENTION: Although the deduplication algorithm is used to determine if a finding should be marked as a false positive, this feature will not work if deduplication is enabled since it doesn't make sense to use both.

retroactive_false_positive_history.description: (EXPERIMENTAL) FP History will also retroactively mark/unmark all existing equal findings in the same product as a false positives. Only works if the False Positive History feature is also enabled.

url_prefix.description: URL prefix if DefectDojo is installed in it's own virtual subdirectory.

enable_product_grade.title: Enable Product Grading
enable_product_grade.description: Displays a grade letter next to a product to show the overall health.

enable_product_tag_inheritance.description: Enables product tag inheritance globally for all products. Any tags added on a product will automatically be added to all Engagements, Tests, and Findings

enable_benchmark.title: Enable Benchmarks
enable_benchmark.description: Enables Benchmarks such as the OWASP ASVS (Application Security Verification Standard)

enable_similar_findings.description: Enable the query of similar findings on the view finding page. This feature can involve potentially large queries and negatively impact performance

engagement_auto_close.title: Enable Engagement Auto-Close
engagement_auto_close.description: Closes an engagement after 3 days (default) past due date including last update.

engagement_auto_close_days.description: Closes an engagement after the specified number of days past due date including last update.

enable_finding_sla.title: Enable Finding SLA's
enable_finding_sla.description: Enables Finding SLA's for time to remediate.

enable_notify_sla_active.title: Enable Notify SLA's Breach for active Findings
enable_notify_sla_active.description: Enables Notify when time to remediate according to Finding SLA's is breached for active Findings.

enable_notify_sla_active_verified.title: Enable Notify SLA's Breach for active, verified Findings
enable_notify_sla_active_verified.description: Enables Notify when time to remediate according to Finding SLA's is breached for active, verified Findings.

enable_notify_sla_jira_only.title: Enable Notify SLA's Breach only for Findings linked to JIRA
enable_notify_sla_jira_only.description: Enables Notify when time to remediate according to Finding SLA's is breached for Findings that are linked to JIRA issues. Notification is disabled for Findings not linked to JIRA issues

enable_notify_sla_exponential_backoff.title: Enable an exponential backoff strategy for SLA breach notifications.
enable_notify_sla_exponential_backoff.description: Enable an exponential backoff strategy for SLA breach notifications, e.g. 1, 2, 4, 8, etc. Otherwise it alerts every day

allow_anonymous_survey_repsonse.title: Allow Anonymous Survey Responses
allow_anonymous_survey_repsonse.description: Enable anyone with a link to the survey to answer a survey

disclaimer_notifications.title: Custom Disclaimer for Notifications
disclaimer_notifications.description: Include this custom disclaimer on all notifications

disclaimer_reports.title: Custom Disclaimer for Reports
disclaimer_reports.description: Include this custom disclaimer on generated reports

disclaimer_reports_forced.title: Force to add disclaimer reports
disclaimer_reports_forced.description: Disclaimer will be added to all reports even if user didn't selected 'Include disclaimer'.

disclaimer_notes.title: Custom Disclaimer for Notes
disclaimer_notes.description: Include this custom disclaimer next to input form for notes

risk_acceptance_form_default_days.description: Default expiry period for risk acceptance form.

risk_acceptance_notify_before_expiration.title: Risk acceptance expiration heads up days
risk_acceptance_notify_before_expiration.description: Notify X days before risk acceptance expires. Leave empty to disable.

enable_credentials.description: With this setting turned off, credentials will be disabled in the user interface.

enable_questionnaires.description: With this setting turned off, questionnaires will be disabled in the user interface.

enable_checklists.description: With this setting turned off, checklists will be disabled in the user interface.

enable_endpoint_metadata_import.description: With this setting turned off, endpoint metadata import will be disabled in the user interface.

enable_user_profile_editable.title: Enable user profile for writing
enable_user_profile_editable.description: When turned on users can edit their profiles

enable_product_tracking_files.description: With this setting turned off, the product tracking files will be disabled in the user interface.

enable_finding_groups.description: With this setting turned off, the Finding Groups will be disabled.

enable_ui_table_based_searching.title: Enable UI Table Based Filtering/Sorting
enable_ui_table_based_searching.description: With this setting enabled, table headings will contain sort buttons for the current page of data in addition to sorting buttons that consider data from all pages.

enable_calendar.description: With this setting turned off, the Calendar will be disabled in the user interface.

enable_cvss3_display.description: With this setting turned off, CVSS3 fields will be hidden in the user interface.

enable_cvss4_display.description: With this setting turned off, CVSS4 fields will be hidden in the user interface.

default_group_email_pattern.description: New users will only be assigned to the default group, when their email address matches this regex pattern. This is optional condition.

minimum_password_length.description: Requires user to set passwords greater than minimum length.

maximum_password_length.description: Requires user to set passwords less than maximum length.

number_character_required.title: Password must contain one digit
number_character_required.description: Requires user passwords to contain at least one digit (0-9).

special_character_required.title: Password must contain one special character
special_character_required.description: Requires user passwords to contain at least one special character (()[]{}|\`~!@#$%^&*_-+=;:'",<>./?).

lowercase_character_required.title: Password must contain one lowercase letter
lowercase_character_required.description: Requires user passwords to contain at least one lowercase letter (a-z).

uppercase_character_required.title: Password must contain one uppercase letter
uppercase_character_required.description: Requires user passwords to contain at least one uppercase letter (A-Z).

non_common_password_required.title: Password must not be common
non_common_password_required.description: Requires user passwords to not be part of list of common passwords.

api_expose_error_details.description: When turned on, the API will expose error details in the response.

filter_string_matching.title: Filter String Matching Optimization
filter_string_matching.description: When turned on, all filter operations in the UI will require string matches rather than ID. This is a performance enhancement to avoid fetching objects unnecessarily.

default_group.description: New users will be assigned to this group.

default_group_role.description: New users will be assigned to their default group with this role.

build_id.description: Build ID that was tested, a reimport may update this field.

commit_hash.description: Commit hash tested, a reimport may update this field.

branch_tag.title: Branch/Tag
branch_tag.description: Tag or branch that was tested, a reimport may update this field.

build_id.description: Build ID that was tested, a reimport may update this field.

commit_hash.description: Commit hash tested, a reimport may update this field.

branch_tag.title: Branch/Tag

slack_username.title: Slack Email Address
slack_username.description: Email address associated with your slack account

block_execution.description: Instead of async deduping a finding the findings will be deduped synchronously and will 'block' the user until completion.

force_password_reset.description: Forces this user to reset their password on next login.

token_last_reset.description: Timestamp of the most recent API token reset for this user.

password_last_reset.description: Timestamp of the most recent password reset for this user.

username.description: Required. 150 characters or fewer. Letters, digits and @/./+/-/_ only.

is_active.title: Active
is_active.description: Designates whether this user should be treated as active. Unselect this instead of deleting accounts.

is_superuser.title: Superuser status
is_superuser.description: Designates that this user has all permissions without explicitly assigning them.

active.description: Force findings to be active/inactive or default to the original tool (None)

verified.description: Force findings to be verified/not verified or default to the original tool (None)

endpoint_to_add.description: Enter the ID of an Endpoint that is associated with the target Product. New Findings will be added to that Endpoint.

engagement_end_date.description: End Date for Engagement. Default is current time + 365 days. Required format year-month-day

build_id.description: ID of the build that was scanned.

branch_tag.description: Branch or Tag that was scanned.

service.description: A service is a self-contained piece of functionality within a Product. This is an optional field which is used in deduplication and closing of old findings when set. This affects the whole engagement/product depending on your deduplication scope.

group_by.description:
Choose an option to automatically group new findings by the chosen option.

* `component_name` - Component Name
* `component_name+component_version` - Component Name + Version
* `file_path` - File path
* `finding_title` - Finding Title
* `vuln_id_from_tool` - Vulnerability ID from Tool

create_finding_groups_for_all_findings.description: If set to false, finding groups will only be created when there is more than one grouped finding

apply_tags_to_findings.description: If set to True, the tags will be applied to the findings

apply_tags_to_endpoints.description: If set to True, the tags will be applied to the endpoints

do_not_reactivate.description: Select if the import should ignore active findings from the report, useful for triage-less scanners. Will keep existing findings closed, without reactivating them. For more information check the docs.

close_old_findings.description: Old findings no longer present in the new report get closed as mitigated when importing. If service has been set, only the findings for this service will be closed; if no service is set, only findings without a service will be closed. This only affects findings within the same test.

close_old_findings_product_scope.description: This has no effect on reimport

version.description: Version that will be set on existing Test object. Leave empty to leave existing value in place.

tags.description: Modify existing tags that help describe this scan. (Existing test tags will be overwritten)

scan_date.description: Scan completion date will be used on all findings.

minimum_severity.description:
Minimum severity level to be imported

* `Info` - Info
* `Low` - Low
* `Medium` - Medium
* `High` - High
* `Critical` - Critical

active.description: Force findings to be active/inactive or default to the original tool (None)

verified.description: Force findings to be verified/not verified or default to the original tool (None)

endpoint_to_add.description: Enter the ID of an Endpoint that is associated with the target Product. New Findings will be added to that Endpoint.

engagement_end_date.description: End Date for Engagement. Default is current time + 365 days. Required format year-month-day

build_id.description: ID of the build that was scanned.

branch_tag.description: Branch or Tag that was scanned.

service.description: A service is a self-contained piece of functionality within a Product. This is an optional field which is used in deduplication and closing of old findings when set. This affects the whole engagement/product depending on your deduplication scope.

group_by.description:
Choose an option to automatically group new findings by the chosen option.

* `component_name` - Component Name
* `component_name+component_version` - Component Name + Version
* `file_path` - File path
* `finding_title` - Finding Title
* `vuln_id_from_tool` - Vulnerability ID from Tool

create_finding_groups_for_all_findings.description: If set to false, finding groups will only be created when there is more than one grouped finding

apply_tags_to_findings.description: If set to True, the tags will be applied to the findings

apply_tags_to_endpoints.description: If set to True, the tags will be applied to the endpoints

do_not_reactivate.description: Select if the import should ignore active findings from the report, useful for triage-less scanners. Will keep existing findings closed, without reactivating them. For more information check the docs.

enum: Dependency Track Finding Packaging Format (FPF) Export

JFrog Xray API Summary Artifact Scan
JFrog Xray On Demand Binary Scan

Recommendation from the security team.

* `A` - Accept (The risk is acknowledged, yet remains)
* `V` - Avoid (Do not engage with whatever creates the risk)
* `M` - Mitigate (The risk still exists, yet compensating controls make it less of a threat)
* `F` - Fix (The risk is eradicated)
* `T` - Transfer (The risk is transferred to a 3rd party)

* `T` - Transfer (The risk is transferred to a 3rd party)

enable_deduplication.title: Deduplicate findings
enable_deduplication.description: With this setting turned on, DefectDojo deduplicates findings by comparing endpoints, cwe fields, and titles. If two findings share a URL and have the same CWE or title, DefectDojo marks the recent finding as a duplicate. When deduplication is enabled, a list of deduplicated findings is added to the engagement view.

delete_duplicates.description: Requires next setting: maximum number of duplicates to retain.

max_dupes.title: Max Duplicates
max_dupes.description: When enabled, if a single issue reaches the maximum number of duplicates, the oldest will be deleted. Duplicate will not be deleted when left empty. A value of 0 will remove all duplicates.

enable_jira_web_hook.description: Please note: It is strongly recommended to use a secret below and / or IP whitelist the JIRA server using a proxy such as Nginx.

disable_jira_webhook_secret.title: Disable web hook secret
disable_jira_webhook_secret.description: Allows incoming requests without a secret (discouraged legacy behaviour)

jira_webhook_secret.title: JIRA Webhook URL
jira_webhook_secret.description: Secret needed in URL for incoming JIRA Webhook

add_vulnerability_id_to_jira_label.title: Add vulnerability Id as a JIRA label

slack_channel.description: Optional. Needed if you want to send global notifications.

slack_token.description: Token required for interacting with Slack. Get one at https://api.slack.com/tokens

slack_username.description: Optional. Will take your bot name otherwise.

msteams_url.description: The full URL of the incoming webhook

webhooks_notifications_timeout.description: How many seconds will DefectDojo waits for response from webhook endpoint

enforce_verified_status.title: Enforce Verified Status - Globally
enforce_verified_status.description: When enabled, features such as product grading, jira integration, metrics, and reports will only interact with verified findings. This setting will override individually scoped verified toggles.

enforce_verified_status_jira.title: Enforce Verified Status - Jira
enforce_verified_status_jira.description: When enabled, findings must have a verified status to be pushed to jira.

enforce_verified_status_product_grading.title: Enforce Verified Status - Product Grading
enforce_verified_status_product_grading.description: When enabled, findings must have a verified status to be considered as part of a product's grading.

enforce_verified_status_metrics.title: Enforce Verified Status - Metrics
enforce_verified_status_metrics.description: When enabled, findings must have a verified status to be counted in metric calculations, be included in reports, and filters.

false_positive_history.description: (EXPERIMENTAL) DefectDojo will automatically mark the finding as a false positive if an equal finding (according to its dedupe algorithm) has been previously marked as a false positive on the same product. ATTENTION: Although the deduplication algorithm is used to determine if a finding should be marked as a false positive, this feature will not work if deduplication is enabled since it doesn't make sense to use both.

retroactive_false_positive_history.description: (EXPERIMENTAL) FP History will also retroactively mark/unmark all existing equal findings in the same product as a false positives. Only works if the False Positive History feature is also enabled.

url_prefix.description: URL prefix if DefectDojo is installed in it's own virtual subdirectory.

enable_product_grade.title: Enable Product Grading
enable_product_grade.description: Displays a grade letter next to a product to show the overall health.

enable_product_tag_inheritance.description: Enables product tag inheritance globally for all products. Any tags added on a product will automatically be added to all Engagements, Tests, and Findings

enable_benchmark.title: Enable Benchmarks
enable_benchmark.description: Enables Benchmarks such as the OWASP ASVS (Application Security Verification Standard)

enable_similar_findings.description: Enable the query of similar findings on the view finding page. This feature can involve potentially large queries and negatively impact performance

engagement_auto_close.title: Enable Engagement Auto-Close
engagement_auto_close.description: Closes an engagement after 3 days (default) past due date including last update.

engagement_auto_close_days.description: Closes an engagement after the specified number of days past due date including last update.

enable_finding_sla.title: Enable Finding SLA's
enable_finding_sla.description: Enables Finding SLA's for time to remediate.

enable_notify_sla_active.title: Enable Notify SLA's Breach for active Findings
enable_notify_sla_active.description: Enables Notify when time to remediate according to Finding SLA's is breached for active Findings.

enable_notify_sla_active_verified.title: Enable Notify SLA's Breach for active, verified Findings
enable_notify_sla_active_verified.description: Enables Notify when time to remediate according to Finding SLA's is breached for active, verified Findings.

enable_notify_sla_jira_only.title: Enable Notify SLA's Breach only for Findings linked to JIRA
enable_notify_sla_jira_only.description: Enables Notify when time to remediate according to Finding SLA's is breached for Findings that are linked to JIRA issues. Notification is disabled for Findings not linked to JIRA issues

enable_notify_sla_exponential_backoff.title: Enable an exponential backoff strategy for SLA breach notifications.
enable_notify_sla_exponential_backoff.description: Enable an exponential backoff strategy for SLA breach notifications, e.g. 1, 2, 4, 8, etc. Otherwise it alerts every day

allow_anonymous_survey_repsonse.title: Allow Anonymous Survey Responses
allow_anonymous_survey_repsonse.description: Enable anyone with a link to the survey to answer a survey

disclaimer_notifications.title: Custom Disclaimer for Notifications
disclaimer_notifications.description: Include this custom disclaimer on all notifications

disclaimer_reports.title: Custom Disclaimer for Reports
disclaimer_reports.description: Include this custom disclaimer on generated reports

disclaimer_reports_forced.title: Force to add disclaimer reports
disclaimer_reports_forced.description: Disclaimer will be added to all reports even if user didn't selected 'Include disclaimer'.

disclaimer_notes.title: Custom Disclaimer for Notes
disclaimer_notes.description: Include this custom disclaimer next to input form for notes

risk_acceptance_form_default_days.description: Default expiry period for risk acceptance form.

risk_acceptance_notify_before_expiration.title: Risk acceptance expiration heads up days
risk_acceptance_notify_before_expiration.description: Notify X days before risk acceptance expires. Leave empty to disable.

enable_credentials.description: With this setting turned off, credentials will be disabled in the user interface.

enable_questionnaires.description: With this setting turned off, questionnaires will be disabled in the user interface.

enable_checklists.description: With this setting turned off, checklists will be disabled in the user interface.

enable_endpoint_metadata_import.description: With this setting turned off, endpoint metadata import will be disabled in the user interface.

enable_user_profile_editable.title: Enable user profile for writing
enable_user_profile_editable.description: When turned on users can edit their profiles

enable_product_tracking_files.description: With this setting turned off, the product tracking files will be disabled in the user interface.

enable_finding_groups.description: With this setting turned off, the Finding Groups will be disabled.

enable_ui_table_based_searching.title: Enable UI Table Based Filtering/Sorting
enable_ui_table_based_searching.description: With this setting enabled, table headings will contain sort buttons for the current page of data in addition to sorting buttons that consider data from all pages.

enable_calendar.description: With this setting turned off, the Calendar will be disabled in the user interface.

enable_cvss3_display.description: With this setting turned off, CVSS3 fields will be hidden in the user interface.

enable_cvss4_display.description: With this setting turned off, CVSS4 fields will be hidden in the user interface.

default_group_email_pattern.description: New users will only be assigned to the default group, when their email address matches this regex pattern. This is optional condition.

minimum_password_length.description: Requires user to set passwords greater than minimum length.

maximum_password_length.description: Requires user to set passwords less than maximum length.

number_character_required.title: Password must contain one digit
number_character_required.description: Requires user passwords to contain at least one digit (0-9).

special_character_required.title: Password must contain one special character
special_character_required.description: Requires user passwords to contain at least one special character (()[]{}|\`~!@#$%^&*_-+=;:'",<>./?).

lowercase_character_required.title: Password must contain one lowercase letter
lowercase_character_required.description: Requires user passwords to contain at least one lowercase letter (a-z).

uppercase_character_required.title: Password must contain one uppercase letter

non_common_password_required.title: Password must not be common
non_common_password_required.description: Requires user passwords to not be part of list of common passwords.
